# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df := hcat(df, mapcolumn(x -> Dates.format.(x, "yyyymm"), df.dt) .|> Int64)
    columns(df)[end] = :ym
    df
end
```

This function, `add_yearmonth`, takes a DataFrame `df` as its argument and creates a new column `ym` by extracting the year and month from the `dt` column, concatenating them together, and converting the result to an integer in the format "yyyymm". It uses the `hcat` function to append the new column to the DataFrame and `mapcolumn` to apply the extract-and-concatenate operation to each row in `dt`. Finally, it sets the name of the new column to `:ym` and returns the updated DataFrame.
